item.title: 美国监管机构对超过 36 万辆福特 SUV 制动失灵展开调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，已开始对美国368,309辆福特Edge汽车因后制动软管故障导致制动失灵的问题进行初步评估。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday it has opened a preliminary evaluation into 368,309 Ford Edge vehicles in the United States over loss of braking caused by rear brake hose failure.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Seven & i 考虑在首次公开募股前出售超市股份
item.description: 两位消息人士称，日本 Seven & i 控股公司正考虑在计划上市前出售其超市业务部门的股份。【原文：Japan's Seven & i Holdings is considering selling a stake in its supermarket unit ahead of a planned listing of the business, two sources said, as the 7-Eleven owner aims to speed up an overhaul after rejecting a takeover from Alimentation Couche-Tard .】

item.title: 在与 Meta 公司的隐私权纠纷中，欧盟最高法院支持活动家施雷姆斯的观点
item.description: 欧洲最高法院周五在奥地利隐私活动家 Max Schrems 与 Meta Platforms 公司的隐私权纠纷案中支持他的观点。【原文：Europe's top court on Friday sided with Austrian privacy activist Max Schrems in his privacy dispute with Meta Platforms .】

item.title: 美国港口罢工凸显工会大敌：自动化
item.description: 美国东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸的码头工人罢工于本周四结束，这次罢工中断了美国大部分的远洋运输，但导致整个美国大陆劳工动荡的一个关键问题--自动化的日益使用--仍未得到解决。【原文：A strike by dockworkers on the U.S. East Coast and Gulf Coast that disrupted much of the nation's ocean shipping this week ended on Thursday, but a key issue driving labor unrest across the continent - the growing use of automation - was unresolved.】

item.title: 法庭文件显示，俄罗斯对壳牌公司提起诉讼
item.description: 周五的法庭文件显示，俄罗斯总检察长已对能源巨头壳牌石油公司的多个部门提起诉讼。【原文：Russia's Prosecutor General has filed a lawsuit against a number of energy major Shell's units, court documents showed on Friday.】

item.title: 日本央行加息计划面临政治难题
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫提高最低借贷成本的努力面临新的挑战，因为日元反弹和新政治领导层对宽松货币政策的偏好提高了加息的门槛。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda's efforts to lift rock-bottom borrowing costs face fresh challenges as a yen rebound and the new political leadership's preference for loose monetary policy raise the hurdle for rate hikes.】

item.title: 预算困境加剧之际，马克龙与华尔街的会谈内幕
item.description: 消息人士本周透露，法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）已向美国高层金融家坦诚地评估了法国的财政困境，并指出了即将到来的增税可能性，以平息人们对法国赤字缺口的担忧。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron has given top U.S. financiers a candid assessment of his country's financial woes, flagging the potential for looming tax increases, sources said this week, in an effort to tamp down concerns over France's gaping deficit.】

item.title: 早间竞价中东紧张局势推动油价上涨
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 日经新闻》称，Seven & i 将于年底前开始出售超市多数股权
item.description: 据《日经商业日报》周五报道，日本 Seven & i 控股公司计划为其超市业务（包括旗舰企业伊藤洋华堂）的多数股权寻找买家，该进程最早将于今年年底启动。【原文：Japan's Seven & i Holdings plans to seek buyers for a majority stake in its supermarket businesses, including its flagship Ito-Yokado, with the process to begin as early as the end of this year, Nikkei business daily reported on Friday.】

item.title: 美国港口罢工结束，但清理船舶长龙仍需时日
item.description: 码头工人和港口运营商达成工资协议，解决了该行业近半个世纪以来最大的停工事件，但清理货物积压仍需时日。【原文：Dockworkers and port operators reached a wage deal to settle the industry's biggest work stoppage in nearly half a century, but clearing the cargo backlog will take time.】

item.title: 预计美国 9 月份就业将温和增长
item.description: 9 月份，美国经济可能保持了温和的就业增长速度，而失业率预计将稳定在 4.2%，这将进一步降低美联储在今年最后两次会议上大幅降息的必要性。【原文：The U.S. economy likely maintained a moderate pace of job growth in September while the unemployment rate is expected to have held steady at 4.2%, which would further reduce the need for the Federal Reserve to deliver large interest rate cuts in its final two meetings of the year.】

item.title: 美国港口罢工结束后航运股下滑
item.description: 周五，在工人与美国港口运营商达成协议，比预期更早结束东海岸和墨西哥湾沿岸码头的罢工后，亚洲各地的航运公司股价大幅下跌。【原文：Shares in shipping companies fell heavily across Asia on Friday after workers and U.S. port operators agreed a deal to end a strike on the East and Gulf coast docks far sooner than expected.】

item.title: 亚洲股市下跌，中东风险导致原油周线收涨
item.description: 周五亚洲股市回落，而油价则创下一年多来的最大单周涨幅，原因是中东紧张局势的升级使市场在当天晚些时候的美国就业报告公布前一直处于紧张状态。【原文：Asian stocks retreated on Friday while oil prices headed for their sharpest weekly gain in more than a year, as escalating tensions in the Middle East kept markets on edge ahead of a U.S. jobs report later in the day.】

item.title: 摩根大通收购澳大利亚资金短缺的明星娱乐公司股份
item.description: 一份交易所文件显示，美国银行摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co）已成为星际娱乐公司（Star Entertainment）的主要股东，因为这家陷入困境的澳大利亚赌场运营商的股价在过去几年中因流动性问题而大幅下跌。【原文：U.S. bank JPMorgan Chase & Co has become a substantial shareholder in Star Entertainment , an exchange filing showed, as shares of the embattled Australian casino operator have fallen sharply in last few years amid liquidity issues.】

item.title: 美元有望创四月以来最大单周涨幅，就业报告成关注焦点
item.description: 由于中东紧张局势加剧带来的避险需求，美元周五维持在六周高位附近，将创下四月以来的最大单周涨幅。【原文：The dollar hung around a six-week high on Friday, set for its biggest weekly gain since April due to safe-haven demand on rising Middle East tensions.】

item.title: 欧盟政府面临对中国电动汽车关税的关键投票
item.description: 欧盟成员国将于周五就是否对进口中国产电动汽车征收最高达 45% 的关税进行关键性投票，这是该集团最受瞩目的贸易案件，有可能遭到中国政府的报复。【原文：European Union members face a pivotal vote on Friday on whether to impose tariffs of up to 45% on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles in the bloc's highest profile trade case, which risks retaliation from Beijing.】

item.title: 中东冲突引发石油上涨，但供应前景限制涨幅
item.description: 周五亚洲交易时段早盘，油价小幅上扬，保持了本周的强劲涨势，原因是投资者权衡了中东冲突和原油流动可能中断与全球市场供应充足之间的关系。【原文：Oil prices inched up in early Asian trading hours on Friday, holding on to their strong weekly gains, as investors weighed the Middle East conflict and the potential disruption in crude flows against an amply-supplied global market.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，在 Vestis 谈判期间，据说 Elis 将出价收购 UniFirst，但遭到拒绝
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，法国工作场所用品供应商 Elis SA 向美国同行 UniFirst 公司提出了非正式收购建议。【原文：French workplace supplies provider Elis SA made an informal takeover proposal to U.S. peer UniFirst Corp , Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 共和党顶级银行链桥银行在美国首次公开募股中融资 4100 万美元
item.description: Chain Bridge Bancorp 是一家自成立以来就深受共和党人欢迎的贷款机构，周四它在美国的首次公开募股定价为每股 22 美元，募集资金 4070 万美元。【原文：Chain Bridge Bancorp , a lender popular among Republicans since its inception, priced its U.S. initial public offering at $22 per share on Thursday to raise $40.7 million.】

item.title: 澳新银行支付 6800 万美元解决两起集体诉讼
item.description: 澳大利亚贷款机构澳新银行（ANZ）周五表示，该行将支付总计 9,900 万澳元（6,776 万美元）的赔偿金，以了结 2020 年对其提起的两起集体诉讼。【原文：Australian lender ANZ said on Friday it will pay a combined sum of A$99 million ($67.76 million) for the settlement of two class actions brought against it in 2020.】

item.title: 中国刺激政策吸引投资者重投陷入困境的房地产行业离岸债券
item.description: 一些中国和全球机构投资者正在重新审视中国的房地产债券，押注随着政府加快努力促进经济增长和重振陷入债务危机的房地产行业，中国房地产债券的前景将有所改善。【原文：Some Chinese and global institutional investors are revisiting Chinese property bonds, betting on an improvement in outlook as the government accelerates efforts to boost economic growth and revive a property sector in the throes of a debt crisis.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，思科将以 230 亿美元的估值投资 CoreWeave
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四援引知情人士的话报道，思科系统公司将投资 CoreWeave，对这家云服务提供商的估值为 230 亿美元。【原文：Cisco Systems is set to invest in CoreWeave, valuing the cloud services provider at $23 billion, according to a Bloomberg News report on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 早间竞标石油阴影笼罩全球市场
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美国精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）正在与债券持有人就可能申请破产的条款进行谈判
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）正在与债券持有人就其与捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）合并失败后可能申请破产的条款进行谈判。【原文：Spirit Airlines is in talks with bondholders over terms of a potential bankruptcy filing in the wake of its failed merger with JetBlue Airways , the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚第三季度上游业务盈利下降
item.description: 埃克森美孚在周四提交的一份监管文件中表示，油价的变化将使该能源巨头第三季度的上游收益减少 6 亿至 10 亿美元。【原文：Exxon Mobil signaled in a regulatory filing on Thursday that changes in oil prices would reduce the energy major's third-quarter upstream earnings by $600 million to $1 billion.】

item.title: 2025 年，美国免费报税系统将扩展到 24 个州，纳税人将达到 3000 万
item.description: 美国财政部周四表示，24 个参与州的 3,000 多万纳税人明年将有资格通过国内税收署扩大的在线直接申报系统免费申报联邦税。【原文：The U.S. Treasury said on Thursday that more than 30 million taxpayers in 24 participating states will be eligible to file their federal taxes for free next year through the Internal Revenue Service's expanded online Direct File system.】

item.title: 美联储票据损失突破 2,000 亿美元大关
item.description: 根据美国联邦储备银行周四公布的数据，本周美国联邦储备银行的损失超过了 2,000 亿美元。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve losses crossed the $200 billion point this week, according to data released on Thursday by the central bank.】

item.title: 特朗普表示，如果他当选，将不允许任何州禁止汽油动力汽车
item.description: 共和党总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，如果他在 11 月当选，任何州都不能禁止以汽油为动力的汽车或卡车。【原文：Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump said on Thursday that, if he is elected in November, no state will be able to ban gas-powered cars or trucks.】

item.title: 艾伯维因研发支出下调 2024 年利润预期
item.description: 艾伯维周四下调了对2024年调整后利润的预期，理由是8200万美元的里程碑以及与收购相关的研发费用。【原文：AbbVie on Thursday lowered its forecast for 2024 adjusted profit, citing $82 million in milestones, and research and development expenses related to acquisitions.】

item.title: 法国总理巴尼耶确认将为大型企业增税
item.description: 法国新任总理米歇尔-巴尼耶（Michel Barnier）周四在法国电视二台（France 2）的节目中表示，法国将提高对国内最大公司和最富有个人的企业税，这证实了此前的媒体报道。【原文：France's new prime minister, Michel Barnier, will increase corporate tax on the biggest companies in the country and on wealthiest individuals, he said on France 2 television on Thursday, confirming earlier media reports.】
